trans-unit.source: Represents one, and only one, of three possible properties of a print queue: <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue.Location"></xref>, <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue.Comment"></xref>, or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue.ShareName"></xref>.
An object of this class is primarily used as a parameter for one of the overloaded <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.InstallPrintQueue%2A> methods of a <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer>.
This method makes it possible to install a print queue while initializing only one of its three major <xref:System.String> properties.
Having three separate overloads of the method is not possible because they would have the same signature and no two overloads of a method can have the same signature.

If you want to install a print queue and initialize two or more of its major string properties, there is another overload, <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.InstallPrintQueue%2A>, that substitutes three <xref:System.String> parameters for the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueueStringProperty> parameter.

These parameters are used to set the major String properties in this order: <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.ShareName%2A>, <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.Comment%2A>, and <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.Location%2A>.
Use an empty string for a parameter that corresponds to a property you do not want to initialize.
Classes within the <xref:System.Printing> namespace are not supported for use within a Windows service or ASP.NET application or service.
Attempting to use these classes from within one of these application types may produce unexpected problems, such as diminished service performance and run-time exceptions.
If you want to print from a Windows Forms application, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueStringProperty"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the value of the print queue property that is represented.

For example, if the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueueStringProperty.Type%2A> is <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueueStringPropertyType.Location>, the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueueStringProperty.Name%2A> might be "Department Supply Room"; but if the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueueStringProperty.Type%2A> is <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueueStringPropertyType.Comment>, the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueueStringProperty.Name%2A> might be "Use only A4 size paper with this printer."
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> with the value of the property.
Gets or sets a value that identifies which of the three possible properties of a print queue is being represented.

The <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.InstallPrintQueue%2A> method of a <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer> uses this information to ensure that the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueueStringProperty.Name%2A> value is assigned to the correct property of the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> being installed.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueStringPropertyType"></xref> that specifies the kind of print queue property that is being represented.
